Reviews.Title: “Hotel Leonardo”
Reviews.Author: Angear77
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in the heart of Cannagerio District, and walking distance from the St. Maria Train Station (with light luggage). The lobby and rooms were clean and bright, a bit off the main street which meant a quiet room. Friendly staff,gave us a map and highlighted most important monuments of Venice. Cons: since this hotel is set back from the main street there is no view and no air circulation in the rooms, in the hottest months this could mean difficulty sleeping, opening the windows will not help as this will allow the mosquitos full access. We were bitten several times during the nights we spent at this hotel, an inroom fan might have helped with the heat, we asked and they didnt not have any for us to use. Overall a nice hotel, I would stay again in more milder weather. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “If you're traveling on a budget this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: Tamar S
Reviews.Content: Only a 10 min walk from the train station, Great location! friendly district loaded with supermarkets and pubs. Female staff were very friendly and had our room ready in no time. The room was big- with an extra bed, a closet and a private bathroom+shower. Very clean, very comfortable. If you're traveling on a budget or just like staying at B&B's Leonardo Hotel is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Took money, refused to honor booking but didn't return cash.”
Reviews.Author: mattfromlancs
Reviews.Content: Booked for this April. The hotel initially took payment on my card, but later contacted me saying the rate quoted was too low (computer error) and demanded more money. I refused and they would not return all of my payment, citing a non-refundable deposit. Incredibly they stuck this despite repeated email and phone contact. As no point were the staff anything less than rude. Because of the timescale involved, and the fact that some money was returned my credit card company would not treat it as fraudulent but instead said it was a contract dispute. To be clear: I changed nothing about my original booking. I hesitate to use the word thieves, but that's certainly how it felt. I wouldn't book here, no matter how cheap, simply because they are not reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good rooms, staff could be kinder”
Reviews.Author: LiorCohen
Reviews.Content: Venice, as you know, or are bound to find out, is not an easy place to travel by foot , in a sense that you'd be better off flowing with the city instead of walking around with your head buried in a map. All of this gives this hotel a very important quality, which is it's proximity to the train station. just a 10 minute walk (and that's when carrying your luggage). when we got to the hotel we were welcomed by a nice lady who showed us to our room (pretty clean, but still a 2star hotel) and gave us good tips regarding our stay. the other recepetionists were less friendly and helpful. all in all a good value stay.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: Dagaz11
Reviews.Content: rooms have seen better times, for sure. location is perfect: very close to train station(only 1 bridge to cross), not in the severely crowded area, farmers market just on the street. breakfast, though, is quite poor. i was booking the hotel by hotels.com, despite the assurance my card won't be charged, hotel's staff charged the money without warning, which created some other issues. there's a small restaurant just under the windows - very loud until late night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small clean might be better after small update”
Reviews.Author: Konstruktorka
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean but bit weared. Very well positine, close to Vaporetto and market. Real Venice is buzzing on Saturdays when market starts. The staff nice and helpful especially Spanish lady. The Venitians are like always Venitians, so no suprise here. Breakfast coffe and roll with jam but you can eat as much you want. Rooms small but comfy

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo_Sadcovitz
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking this hotel. Read all reviews and decided to stay. Excelent choice I did. Very easy to get from Piazzale Roma, great neighborhood with lots of shops restaurants and half way to everything. Nice triple room with standard Italian breakfast. Staff very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel but not Central”
Reviews.Author: Zoom_Gotti
Reviews.Content: If you have lots of baggage, you might want to look elsewhere. If you arrive by rail, you'll have to walk over one bridge to get here. If by private water taxi from the airport, perhaps one or none depending on where the driver drops you off. If at the bus depot, it's a 2 bridge walk or a 2-stop vaporetto ride (with a short walk). The hotel is small and quaint with a sign on the main street but the entry is in the alley. Room sizes vary with basic furnishings, TV, and some with air. You might have a view and you might not (remember the entry is in an alley). Shopping and restaurants are right outside the door and you can walk most anywhere in time, including to St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge area. One vaporetto stop is nearby and the one to the islands is not too far away. The Old Ghetto historic area is just around the corner. The hotel offers a starter breakfast but having said that, you'll probably need to eat again 2 hours later. In busy season prices get steep and the hotel uses a nearby building with additional flats. If staying in Venice in a basic accommodation suits your style, and you accept the challenge of walking or taking a vaporetto (buy a pass) to the major attractions, then you might choose to stay here. You'll be near the rail station and budget eateries but still some distance from the higher quality hotels and San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: andrewth1
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a very friendly guy, who i believe to be the hotel owner. We had an air conditioned room, but with so much to see we were straight back out! We got our bearings pretty easily. The hotel is situated in a quite street just off the main bit. Very good location for transport links in and out of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A”
Reviews.Author: JRCUk
Reviews.Content: We booked 1 night at Hotel Leonardo when we arrived in Venice with our friends. After a bit of a stressful start to our trip we were relieved to find the man on the reception really helpful. He was able to give us lots of useful advice for our transfer to the airport which was really early the next day and he also helped some of our other friends who were trying to find their hotel in another part of Venice. The room was spacious with air- con and it was a really quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: jackwinfield
Reviews.Content: The location is the best aspect of Hotel Leonardo; just 10 minutes walk from Santa Lucia train station and a bustling hub of bars and restaurants. The service was friendly and English-friendly as well, although the room was only equipped with a weak fan and so was rather stuffy. However, I had a pleasant 1 night stay that was only booked 2 days before, and I was generally pleased. Would definitely consider staying here again should I return to Venice

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: travellingmonkey865
Reviews.Content: Service at the hotel is friendly and the location is easy to find, just out the way of the crowds and within walking distance to many of the sights. However the rooms are disguisting and basic, the walls in our room were peeling and dead bugs squashed all over the walls(I found myself adding to these at 3 in the morning as the bugs do not let you sleep) on the first morning we also discovered BED BUGS!! We instantly complained to the staff and were given a new room however not much changed we were still eaten alive by bed bugs and other creepy crawly guests at the hotel. We decided not to trust eating the breakfast there and found a very nice pastry ship over the street. The room was made up and fresh towels were left daily however I did keep finding random black hairs in the bed (god knows what happened there) my wife is blonde and I have brown hair so can assure you they weren't ours! For over 100euros a night! this place is far from worth the price we will NEVER stay there again and will warn others with extreme prejudice not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kiddino
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't too difficult to find and actually is within walking distance from the train/bus stations. Our room left a bit to be desired though. There were dead bugs smashed on the ceilings and water leak spots on the ceiling as well. The shower was small and there wasn't any where to store your soaps and shampoos. Fresh towels were provided daily, but we still found random hairs on the bed every day, so I'm not sure how well the rooms were actually cleaned. Pros: -Location was pretty good -The people who worked there were nice and helpful Cons: -Our room was just dingy and gross! While the service was decent, we had a very early checkout on the day that we left. We had told them that ahead of time, but when we went to check out there was no one at the front desk. We knew that someone had to be there, because there was a padlock on the inside of the door (so we were basically locked in). We had to use our cell phone to call the main number, and someone did come to check us out (he was in one of the rooms asleep). No one told us that we would have to call to wake someone up to check us out, so that was an inconvenience for us. Overall, we weren't thrilled with our stay here, and we wouldn't stay here again or recommend it to anyone. Look for someplace else to stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location shame about the accomodation!!”
Reviews.Author: NishaO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and very easy to find. It's a short distance away from the train station and 20 minute walk from San Marco Sq. Our room was very basic but clean. We had no hot water and it's poorly maintained (with live wires hanging from some of the plug sockets)! We were situated on the ground floor, so it was noisy when people walked past. I wouldn't stay there again and I don't think it's very good value for money but the staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location but its not the best place you stay”
Reviews.Author: Sidihmed A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in very close and in very central location, but donâ€™t expect anything fancy. The rooms are simple and basic clean. If you are looking for place where you can shower sleep and leave your luggage well that will be very suitable The Staff are polite and always willing to help

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay there.”
Reviews.Author: ASK54
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is on a quiet alley in an interesting section of the city, but it is very modest. The shower had no hot water and the wallpaper is peeling. What they call breakfast consisted of a hot drink and one roll. We would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for the Price!!”
Reviews.Author: StefSparks
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff here was extremely friendly. The hotel is located very close to the train station. A group of four of us stayed here for three nights total. The first night we stayed in the main hotel. The second and third night we moved to the annex, so we could have four single beds. And the annex is extremely nice. It is much nicer than the main hotel, and it is only a five minute walk. At 100 Euros a night, you cannot beat the accommodations. The hotel doesn't provide internet, but it is only a few paces from a couple of internet cafes.

Reviews.Title: “NOT IMPRESSED!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tina392009
Reviews.Content: As we had only 1.5 days in Venice, we chose a Hotel that was as close as possible to the train station since Venice is a maze and we didn't want to waste time. We got to the hotel early in the morning and left our baggage in the storeroom , and left to see the sites. We told them that we will officially check-in late afternoon/early evening. When we got there the staff told us that the man hadn't checked out of 'our' room and that he will be staying the night since he was very ill. They told us that we were being moved to the sister hotel 'Antica Raffineria' which was a long walk away AND we had to walk over bridges and stairs at night with suitcases after a LONG day walking around Venice. We were accompanied by the owner's son and he was such a helpful and pleasant person AND even came to help me with my luggage the next morning.We didn't expect that Venice was so complicated. So we had to change our plans for the next morning as we were further away from our 'original hotel'. We had our check-out time extended until 11am. So, we were provided with breakfast by a very rude man and he told me that he wanted me to check out earlier as he needed to get the room ready for a tour group. I found him to be very rude and showing no empathy for our situation which was caused by their unprofessionalism in the first place. We were unimpressed and we will NEVER here again even though the sister hotel 'Antica Raffineria' was clean and roomy. To conclude, please do not stay here. I certainly will not be ever again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool little hotel with good staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: GrahamRS
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Leonardo for 4 nights in early January. Pros: Good location near a main pedestrian walkway Friendly and helpful staff Large room with character Staff makes delicious beverages in the morning Secure bag storage Rooms cleaned daily Cons: No internet access (but you can buy it next door if your room is on the far side and gets the signal) A bunch of small moths lived in our room We were on the ground floor so lots of noise and spitting (yes spitting it was wierd) Beds weren't super comfortable Breakfast consists of only 2 buns with cherry or apricot jam Overall we enjoyed this hotel. It's quaint and has character and the staff are great. The location is fine and really we didn't spend a whole lot of time in our room because Venice is so amazing. Be prepared to deal with the no internet situation, even though their website says it is available. Don't stay on the ground floor if possible it was super loud and the two single beds pushed together were not that comfortable. I recommend it because its cool and fun and if you want a cheap hotel in Venice on the main island I doubt you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Antica Raffinera is a good option”
Reviews.Author: countryboy_10
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a room at Hotel Leonardo, but they moved us to their â€œnew accommodationâ€�, the Antica Raffinera, which doesnâ€™t yet have a listing on Trip Advisor. The accommodation was actually very nice. The location was about a 15 minute walk from the train station. The actual B&B is a little ways off the main street. This does mean that it is very quiet. The workers at the B&B were very helpful with suggesting sights to see in Venice. As well, they helped us find a laundromat, something we desperately needed upon arriving in Venice! The accommodation puts you in reasonably decent walking distance to San Marco (~30 minutes) and the Rialto Bridge (~20 minutes). Venice is small enough that everything is close by and it is unique enough that really any neighborhood is an interesting area to be situated as a tourist. The room was quite modern, was very clean and had air conditioning (a necessity in Venice!!). Breakfast was quite sparse, but that is typical for Italy. We were served a roll and tea/coffee/juice. Accommodations in Venice are fairly pricey, particularly as you get close to San Marco. I felt the price at Antica Raffinera was very reasonable (around 70 Euros/night) and was an affordable starting place to see Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: Treadted2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple here for two nights. Really the only good things I have to say are that the staff is pleasant, and the location is pretty convenient. The room was clean, but with no frills, old everything, stuff falling apart. The bathroom shower door would hardly open, and the shower head wouldn't stay up. Breakfast was very miniscule. Bread, jam, coffee, juice.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but clean and central”
Reviews.Author: Boginia
Reviews.Content: This hotel could use some work, is quite old, but the room was clean and large. The lower floor can be noisy. The staff is not that nice. But is sooooo central, great location! The breakfast was not excellent but it was ok. They also have free luggage deposit witch is great to continue to visit Veneza even after check out and before living Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills”
Reviews.Author: elyoar
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and the pictures looked good. However, when we arrived, we were told that the hot water wasn't working properly and that we had to be moved to another building. After walking quite a few blocks with our luggage, we arrived at our room. It was basically a basement guest room. It was clean, we had a private bathroom with good water pressure in the shower. The a/c worked fine. The mattress was hard and uncomfortable - making it difficult to get a comfortable night's sleep. The breakfast consisted of a couple of stale buns, jam and coffee from a machine. The employee's were pleasant and helpful. We were looking for a place to sleep and clean up while we did our sightseeing, and that's exactly what we got. No more, no less.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel,friendly staff,great location for all the sights.”
Reviews.Author: ayupmiduk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights,for Venice the room rates were very reasonable. It is a family run hotel..Maria is one of the owners but also serves breakfast amongst other things..any help you need is there. The hotel is a little old fashioned a needs a little tlc here & there but that gives it a genuine Venetian feel.We had en suite..towels changed daily & bedrooms serviced. There are no great views from the hotel but the location makes up for it. There is an ATM right on the corner, good priced bars & restaurants on the canal in the Jewish Quarter 5 mins away...the owners will direct you. Try restaurant Diana 2 courses 12 euros & a litre of house wine 10 euros..there are more like this too. Bars in this area are cheap too..large bottles of beer 3euros wine 1.5 euros glass. We had great weather which helped too.All the main sights are a stroll away or get a vaporetto ticket for the day , 16 euros,& go where you please. The walk from the bus station is only 8 or 10mins. When we visit this city again we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Blech”
Reviews.Author: kristy_kingx
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the new "annex" of the Hotel Leonardo. The location was actually really good--there were some fabulous restaurants right on the canal. The hotel itself had all the charm of a prison cell. It was extremely shabby and loveless. The owner/manager was nice but the place is really pretty dreadful. We stayed in 5 different hotels during our trip through Italy--all between 60 and 80 euro--and this was by far the least charming and least pleasant. The breakfast was particularly sad. Also, no wifi! Find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SDHydro
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel. Yes the rooms are tiny. Yes the private bathroom was small and the shower felt like an MRI tube, but when you go to Venice you don't go stay in your room. The hotel is a very short walk from the train station. This is good because you don't have to carry your bags far. The staff was very helpful and friendly. What was really great about the hotel was the location. It is just off a main street (but the room was very quiet) where we were able to find lots of moderately priced restaurants, inexpensive gift shops, an open air fruit and vegitable market, a supermarket, and a very short walk to an area that had more locals than tourists - we had a very relaxing and wonderful espresso at a bar where we were the only tourist. There are two vaperrato stops within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. The breakfast was found wanting; one cup of coffee, one stale roll, and one pat of butter was not much. But after traveling in Italy for over two weeks we were used to skimpy breakfasts, and it is easy to find great, inexpensive food in Italy. If you are watching your budget this is an excellent place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value -- so friendly!”
Reviews.Author: EnglishProfessor8
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here and would absolutely come back, largely because I found all the staff here incredibly friendly, kind, and helpful. The accommodations are not fancy, but my bed was quite comfortable and everything was very clean. Bathroom/shower in the hallway was not a problem, very good water pressure. I needed a couple extra items for my room and they were promptly provided. The location cannot be beat -- 5 min. walk to vaporettos on the Grand Canal, also walkable with luggage on wheels to and from the Piazalle Roma. The people complaining here about the breakfast are idiots: step outside and find yourself an espresso and pastry for a few euros. For restaurants close by, try Trattorio da Gigio, Gam Gam, and Bentigodi Osteria da Francesca -- excellent local cuisine and superb service. Mille grazie to Hotel Leonardo for a very memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: tudrus
Reviews.Content: the Leonardo has just been renovated and has added a few more rooms at a second nearby location we stayed at the new location and were very pleased all the furnishing were new the owner was very pleasant and helpful therefore it was a great deal for the money

Reviews.Title: “great value, central”
Reviews.Author: alicja29
Reviews.Content: Booked through travel republic, I stayed for one night before I started work in Mestre. For a single room in August I paid Â£33 which was a bargain. The hotel is central and clean and tidy, this is a budget hotel so don't go in expecting the most luxurious surroundings. My single room wasn't actually a single and had a double bed, and ensuite bathroom all clean and presentable. For Venice the room was very spacious, with two chairs, a wardrobe and set of drawers and television. Being on the ground floor it was a bit noisy but that was mainly because of the party they were having in the restaurant next door. I was impressed with the service, when I arrived at the hotel the guy on the reception already knew my name! I was shown my room and deposited my luggage, although my room wasn't quite ready yet as I did arrive at 11:30 am. Breakfast, I must admit wasn't spectacular but when you've saved on the hotel you can afford to buy a coffee somewhere else if your that bothered! Overall my stay was good and the staff where able to give me exact directions to the school I was starting work at, even though it was in a different town! For the price I paid and the time of year I have no complaints.

HotelInfo.Name: Leonardo Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle della Masena 1385, 30100 Venice, Italy
